Package main.markdownExcel

Class MarkdownTableBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.markdownExcel.MarkdownTableBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TableBuilder

    public final class MarkdownTableBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
implements TableBuilder

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      TableBuilder appendColumn​(java.lang.String title)
      Appends one empty column to the right end of the table
      TableBuilder appendColumn​(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String... vec)
      Appends a new column to the right end of the table and fills it with the values of the specified vector.
      TableBuilder appendRow​()
      Appends an empty row to the bottom of the table.
      TableBuilder appendRow​(Vector vec)
      Appends a row to the bottom of this table and fills it with the values of the supplied Vector.
      ImmutableTable build​()
      Creates an ImmutableTable-Instance from this table builder and returns it.
      TableBuilder forEachColumn​(VectorOperation op)
      Executes the VectorOperation op for all columns.
      TableBuilder forEachRow​(VectorOperation op)
      Executes the VectorOperation op for all rows.
      TableBuilder forSingleColumn​(int index, VectorOperation op)
      Executes the VectorOperation op for the given column.
      TableBuilder forSingleRow​(int index, VectorOperation op)
      Executes the VectorOperation op for the given row.
      TableBuilder fromFile​(java.lang.String path)
      Creates a new markdown table by parsing the content of the supplied file.
      TableBuilder fromImmutableTable​(ImmutableTable table)
      Creates a new markdown table by parsing the content of the supplied immutable table.
      TableBuilder fromScratch​(int rows, int columns)
      Creates a new empty markdown table with the supplied amount of columns and rows+2 (for the header row and column formatting row).
      Vector getColumn​(int index)
      Returns a column.
      Vector getRow​(int index)
      Returns a row.
      TableBuilder insertColumn​(int index, java.lang.String title)
      Inserts a new empty column at the specified index
      TableBuilder insertColumn​(int index, java.lang.String title, java.lang.String... vec)
      Inserts a new column into the table at the specified index and fills it with the values of the specified vector.
      TableBuilder insertRow​(int index)
      Inserts a new empty row at the specified index.
      TableBuilder insertRow​(int index, Vector vec)
      Inserts a pre-filled row at the specified index.
      TableBuilder removeColumn​(int index)
      Removes the column with the specified index from the table
      TableBuilder removeRow​(int index)
      Removes the selected row from this table
      TableBuilder setFormatting​(int columnIndex, ColumnFormatting formatting)
      Sets the formatting for a specific column.
      TableBuilder setFormattings​(ColumnFormatting... formattings)
      Sets the formatting for every column.
      TableBuilder setHeader​(java.lang.String... values)
      Sets the values of the header row to the supplied String[].
      TableBuilder setHeader​(Vector values)
      Sets the header row of this table to the values of the supplied vector.

      • setFormattings

        public TableBuilder setFormattings​(ColumnFormatting... formattings)
        Description copied from interface: TableBuilder
        Sets the formatting for every column. If more values are supplied than columns exist, the remaining values will be discarded. If less values are supplied, the remaining columns stay unchanged.
        Specified by:
        setFormattings in interface TableBuilder
        Parameters:
        formattings - the format values that are to be applied
        Returns:
        The TableBuilder-Instance with updated format values

      • build

        public ImmutableTable build​()
        Description copied from interface: TableBuilder
        Creates an ImmutableTable-Instance from this table builder and returns it. NOTE: This is a terminating operation. ImmutableTable has no direct access to this builder and can't modify its own values. A new TableBuilder-Instance is needed if further modification is desired.
        Specified by:
        build in interface TableBuilder
        Returns:
        An ImmutableTable.
